column1: The National Sleep Foundation recommends that school-aged kids (6–13 years) sleep between 9 and 11 h a night. Teens are recommended to get 8–10 h a night and adults about 7–9 h. If you are a student
column3: you may find it difficult to get this amount of sleep on school nights. As you go through puberty
column4: your body wants to go to bed later and sleep later. But school (particularly in the U.S.) often starts too early! This makes it hard for teenagers to get enough sleep on school nights. By the weekend
column5: you probably have missed so much sleep that you feel particularly sleepy
column6: and you may dramatically oversleep as your sleep homeostat works hard to recover the sleep you need. If you oversleep all weekend
column8: this can make waking up on Monday morning a miserable experience.
